On 4/16/10 12:04 AM, Bernd wrote:
 >
 > Dear All,
 >
 > while writing an connector for Heritrix --> SOLR I got confused
 > by "Content-Type" of "ArchiveRecordHeader" between ARC and WARC format.
 >
 > With ARC format the Content-Type of ArchiveRecordHeader describes the
 > content of the record, the "payload".
 >
 > With WARC format the Content-Type of ArchiveRecordHeader describes its
 > own header. Luckily extended by "msgtype". Nevertheless the
 > ArchiveRecordHeader says nothing about its "payload" and if only feeding
 > say "text/html" I have to also analyze the content of the record.
 >
 > 1) why this change?

the ARC format contains only HTTP responses. the WARC format contains
a richer set of metadata, including HTTP request records. original
HTTP Content-Type fields are included in the payload of "WARC-Type:
response" records.

 > 2) why not naming the "Content-Type" of the header "WARC-Content-Type"
 > and also for "WARC-Content-Length"?

i'm not sure, but perhaps it is intended to be apparent that the
Content-Type found in the WARC header applies to the WARC record,
while the content type in the payload (if extant) applies to the
payload, and likewise for Content-Length. also, there may be some
desire to be name-consistent with the referenced RFCs.

perhaps Heritrix could make it easier to get at the underlying
content type of a response record in WARCs by adding a
payload-content-type accessor to ArchiveRecordHeader, which
is not defined for ARCs. however, this might be a slippery slope.
what other payload fields might we want accessors for? is this
problem better solved by just peeking into the payload?

 > 3) while having a "WARC-Payload-Digest", why not having a
 > "WARC-Payload-Content-Type"?

this might be considered redundant with Content-Type found in HTTP
response headers when extant, and fulfilled by the Content-Type of the
WARC header when not.

please feel free to also post your questions about the WARC
specification to the "WARC Tools" group as well.

http://groups.google.com/group/warc-tools

hope that helps.
